intro: Agrostophyllum leucocephalum, commonly known as the white-headed grass or white-headed agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, often forming part of the vegetation in fynbos ecosystems. Its unique appearance and habitat make it an important species in local biodiversity. It is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
